item.dc:creator: @Pyru Pyru
item.description:
@Pyru wrote:

Snosaven24:

Keith advises. Think of him as a just a single member on the board of directors of a large company. As for the total, supreme owner? I do not know. RSCR was Keith, Battle-X is anyone’s guess.

Snosaven24, even if that is the case, you’re still in violation of the rules stated. You just said in a previous post, that you are not the owner of Battle-X.

Snosaven24:

I am not the owner of Battle-X, I am simply posting an advertisement of the server. I am NOT posting on the owner’s behalf, I am NOT posting an advertisement because of the owner, and I am NOT mentioning the owner. I am simply posting an advertisement of the server and only the server.

Only the owner of a server may post an advertisement. Getting another person to post for a banned members server is strictly prohibited, and will result in a server censorship.

Also, who wouldn’t be threatened with this as an online count:

HaP9ZqU.png?11288×535

item.dc:creator: @Pyru Pyru
item.description:
@Pyru wrote:

[quote=“Snosaven24, post:23, topic:521947”]I am not the owner of Battle-X, I am simply posting an advertising of the server. I am NOT posting on the owner’s behalf, I am NOT posting an advertisement because of the owner, and I am NOT mentioning the owner. I am simply posting and advertisement of the server and only the server.

Look, Pyru is afraid of competition. That’s natural for an owner of a server. To entertain his ramblings is to show bias towards one particular server. I do not think that is something Mopar really wants to do. Mopar might not have bias, but shutting down particular advertisements and leaving Emulation’s advertisement up when there is so much evidence of their malintent over the years IS in fact showing bias whether that bias exists or not.

This advertisement is of Battle-X as a server, not Battle-X as a project of Keith’s. Keith has NOTHING to do with this. I provided PROOF that the client was NOT MALICIOUS IN ANY WAY and received permission to post. Competition is healthy, Pyru, rivalry is not. Remember that.[/quote]

Once again. The rules state clearly, you may not post an advertisement for a server that you do not own. Furthermore, you’re not allowed to post a server for an owner / operator who has been banned from Moparscape.

Competition and fear? Unlikely. You peak at 10 members online, which I would assume aren’t unique. The same type of server, with the same owner has failed in the past and will fail again.

You yourself just stated that you do not own Battle-X and yet are posting an advertisement for it. If you failed to comprehend which rules you were breaking, when I previously made you aware, I’ll show you again.

Only the owner of a server may post an advertisement. Getting another person to post for a banned members server is strictly prohibited, and will result in a server censorship.

Read full topic

@Snosaven24 wrote:

I am not the owner of Battle-X, I am simply posting an advertisement of the server. I am NOT posting on the owner’s behalf, I am NOT posting an advertisement because of the owner, and I am NOT mentioning the owner. I am simply posting an advertisement of the server and only the server.

Look, Pyru is afraid of competition. That’s natural for an owner of a server. To entertain his ramblings is to show bias towards one particular server. I do not think that is something Mopar really wants to do. Mopar might not have bias, but shutting down particular advertisements and leaving Emulation’s advertisement up when there is so much evidence of their mal-intent over the years IS in fact showing bias whether that bias exists or not.

This advertisement is of Battle-X as a server, not Battle-X as a project of Keith’s. Keith has NOTHING to do with this. I provided PROOF that the client was NOT MALICIOUS IN ANY WAY and received permission to post. Competition is healthy, Pyru, rivalry is not. Remember that.

item.dc:creator: @Dustin_Jr Dustin Jr
item.description:
@Dustin_Jr wrote:

[quote=“Pyru, post:16, topic:521947”][quote author=Dustin Jr link=topic=640455.msg4315723#msg4315723 date=1371443836]

This server looks interesting.

Pyru, you are not staff here. You can report a post, but please don’t spam up a thread because you are afraid of competition. It’s all too obvious why you have a vested interest in this topic being removed.

Errorist,

There is no fear of competition, on a server that has 10 people online during peak. This server has already been advertised here for a month, then removed because evidence was produced that “The Djinn” was Keith. I never once said I was staff, or implied I was either. I was only posting the rules, which should be enforced, especially in order to protect users from a known scammer. If people want to play there after knowing the facts, then that’s their choice.

100% agree with you, except you should know better and just report the post, or pm a mod, as posting in the thread is just spamming, which can lead to you getting in to trouble, cmon i know your site don’t have report button, but you should be smarter than that pie roo
[/quote]

I did report the post. I am also only posting, to make other users aware of potential risks joining this server may impose, which isn’t against the rules, especially since proof was produced that the owner is known for malicious activity in the past.[/quote]
My penis has been strucken with rigamortis.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Pyru Pyru
item.description:
@Pyru wrote:

Snosaven24:

I am advertising for a server, not for Keith. I can post an advertisement for Keith if you’d like, but I think that would be on some weird level I don’t care to cross. Anyway, this advertisement is for Battle-X and Battle-X alone. There is not a single mention of Keith or The Djinn anywhere in the entire post because, well, it just simply isn’t about him at all.

That’s irrelevant, the server is owned by him. The rules should be enforced, as he’s previously condoned in malicious activity and harmed his users. If Moparscape allows an advertisement here for a known scammer (as it is a server he runs and owns) and the same activity were to follow, then they’re at fault for knowingly reinstating the advertisement and directing traffic there, potentially causing more harm on other innocent users.

If a moderator gave you permission, then so be it. I’m just stating my thoughts in regards to the situation. Good luck!

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Pyru Pyru
item.description:
@Pyru wrote:

Snosaven24:

I asked for permission to post this advertisement and I received that permission. If there is proof of what you said, I have never seen it nor experienced it. We can dispense of the formalities though, since we both know what is going on here.

Hopefully the moderator(s) who gave you the permission to re-post, were aware of Keiths history and the severity of his offenses. As stated, you’re advertising for someone who’s been permanently banned from this site, due to the nature of his offenses, which weren’t minor. It may affect your credibility / reputation in the future.

item.dc:creator: @Pyru Pyru
item.description:
@Pyru wrote:

Snosaven24:

An owner being banned does not mean that server can’t be advertised if the client is not malicious and the server does not do anything that would be frowned upon in the private server community. The reason for the owner being banned is irrelevant if the server and client are within these parameters.

The rules state the opposite, mainly this:

Getting another person to post for a banned members server is strictly prohibited, and will result in a server censorship.

There has been proof provided, showing that Keith has not only had malicious content within his servers, but has also scammed people out of money. Regardless, I am not trying to argue with you, and if it stays up so be it. This will just give any other owner who’s been banned from here for similar reasons in the past, a “loophole” to re-posting their servers. It wouldn’t be fair to allow this server to do it and not another.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tigerclan tigerclan
item.description:
@tigerclan wrote:

Snosaven24:

An owner being banned does not mean that server can’t be advertised if the client is not malicious and the server does not do anything that would be frowned upon in the private server community. The reason for the owner being banned is irrelevant if the server and client are within these parameters.

Contrary to your beliefs, Moparscape isn’t a democracy. Don’t act like you have “rights” to post a server that’s advertisement was removed and who’s owner was banned.

Read full topic
